doc.title: Hagar
doc.plot: The worst hours for Hagar are just before she goes to work on the street. Her encounters with her pimp, costumers and violence, are unbearable. She keeps telling herself tonight would be the last time, but still ends up at the same spot on the same street corner every night. One night Hagar meets a wealthy moonstruck customer. He forces his unfaithful wife's identity on Hagar, temporarily allowing her to escape from her harsh reality. However, it is in this escape that brings Hagar to an identity crisis. Should she adopt the illusion in the new fake identity her client is offering her, disregarding her own name and dreams, or return to the cold but familiar street corner, to her abusive pimp, in one last attempt to save her fading identity?
